the Mexicans were too frightened to

would not risk coming forward they shied
away as if these spaniards were wild

begged permission of their king to hold

early the next morning the statues face

on top of the pyramid the procession

those would fast it for twenty days and

dance with all your hearts
at this moment in the Fiesta when the

all ran forward armed as if for battle
they closed the entrances and
passageways all the gates of the patio
the Eagle gate in the lesser palace the

they attacked the man who was drumming
and cut off his arms they attacked all
the celebrants stabbing them spearing

they attacked some of them from behind
and those fell instantly to the ground
no matter how hard they tried to save

attempted to force their way out but the

others climbed the walls but they could
not save themselves those who ran into
the communal houses were safe there for
a while so were those who lay down among

if they stood up again the Spaniards saw
them and killed them the blood of the
warriors flows like water and gathered
into pools when the news of this
Massacre was heard outside the sacred
patio three great cries went up
mexicanos come running bring your Spears
and shields the strangers have murdered
our warriors the cry was answered with a
roar of grief and anger the people
shouted and wailed and beat their palms

assembled at once as if the hour had

carried their spears and shields then

mists
spread over the spaniards like a yellow

in Chains the mexicans who had died in

mexicans were enraged because the attack

the Warriors had been killed without the

mexicans kept a close watch to prevent

the spaniards they also stopped

the Mexicans kept them under attack for

they obstructed all the roads and

a great plague broke out here in
Tenochtitlan it began to spread during
the thirteenth month and lasted for 70

sores erupted on our faces our breasts
our bellies we were covered with

common people were terrified at the

moaning with fear and paddling as
swiftly as they could they left all
their possessions behind them and
abandoned their little farms without
looking back
our enemies seized all our possessions
they gathered up everything they could
find and loaded it onto the ships in
great bundles they stole their cloaks
and blankets our battle dress our tables
and drums and carried them all away when
the spaniards reached shallow koh near

destroyed it with four shots from the
largest cannon when the Aztecs
discovered that the shots from the Aqua
buses and cannons always flew in a

if they saw that a cannon was about to

running they threw themselves to the
ground and lay until the shot had passed

among the houses darting into the spaces
between them the road was suddenly as
empty as if it passed through a desert
the brigand teens came up and anchored

now they anchored a short distance from

they threw in the stones from the
